text: Temple College Vocational Nursing Program VNSG 1409: Nursing in Health and Illness II Module I Objectives Upon completion of this module the student will be able to: Complementary and Alternative Medicine: DeWitt Chapter 32 and Williams/Hopper Chapter 5 1. Define and provide examples of complementary and alternative therapies or modalities; including: Allopathic, Ayurvedic, Traditional Chinese, Chiropractic, Homeopathic, Naturopathic, American Indian, Folk Medicine, and Osteopathic Medicine. 2. Identify common herbs and their intended properties and uses. 3. Discuss LVN’s role in assisting a patient with complementary or alternative therapies, keeping in mind safety issues surrounding their use. Nursing Care of Patients in Pain: Williams/Hopper Chapter 10 1. Define pain, addiction, physical dependence, and tolerance while identifying common myths and barriers to effective management of pain. 2. Know how to perform a basic pain assessment, identify pain medication treatment modalities, and use of non-pharmacological pain management techniques. Nursing Care of Patients at the End of Life: Williams/Hopper Chapter 17 1. Identify patient’s end of life choices and necessary legal documents for patients with life-limiting illness. 2. Describe physical changes to expect during the dying process, nursing interventions for patients at the end of life, and postmortem care.
